To add extra sources to my Managed Make Builder progect, I added to it new
linked folder. It was recognised as a new sourses container. Then I added this
new container as a new source folder (this is an optional step I supose, it
didn't change anything) and built project. Extra sources were compiled, errors
and warnings were output to the console, but entries in the problems list were
not created. Why?
Then in C/C++ view I deleted this linked folder. It was not deleted
automatically from Debug folder and next build caused a bunch of errors to be
output into the .log file:
Errors running builder "Generated Makefile Builder" on project testManaged.
Resource /testManaged/testCLinked does not exist.
Maybe this is a wrong way to add extra sources to MMB project? Using linked
resources for that looks not perfect because besides the problems described
before, I cannot avoid inclusion of the binary container from linked folder to
my MMB project binary container.
Another question. I'm trying to add extra objects file at the link stage. I use
C linker->Miscellaneous->Other objects for that. If I add something to this
list, then select another options tree node (General, for instance), when I
return back to Miscellaneous, the extra objects list is empty. If I want to
delete element from Other Objects table (this is definetly a file), IDE asks me:
"Are you sure you want to delete selected DIRECTORIES?".

There are a lot of bugs reported here.

(A) Build error for source located in a linked directory do not show up in 
problem view.
(B) Problems when deleting a linked directory: the generated directory for the 
build output is not deleted.
(C) Adding an external object file, switching to a new option, then switching 
back, causes the UI to lose the original setting.
(D) When deleting a file(s), the message uses the term "directories".

Dealing with the simplest problems first, I cannot duplicate (C) in 2.0.X. I 
can add, change to another option, edit it (or not), then go back and still 
have a value there. I can only assume that this was caused by round-tripping 
the option for your custom toolchain, and since that is not done in 2.1, I am 
going to assume this bug is fixed. 

All deletions result in a message with "directories" in it. I cannot change 
that in the 2.0.X stream because of I18N issues. However, I will fix this in 
HEAD so that the message reads "files or directories".

I cannot duplicate (A) either. I have a project with a linked directory 
structure that supplies all of the source for a project and errors/warnings 
all show up in the problem view and support double-click navigation.

I cannot test it right now. I have to repare QNX tool chain definition before
that because since last time I committed it to CVS some changes in CDT MMS made
it unworkable. As soon as I fix the problem, I'll test it and let you know about
my results. Sorry.

B is a real problem. Upon receiving the REMOVE notification, the makefile 
generator for GNU was putting deleted directory in a list of modified dirs. It 
then went off and tried to regenerate the makefiles for that directory. The 
solution is to add the directory to a list of deleted dirs and remove the 
generated directory.
